Other cooking methods may have different ranges. %1$s can only be used with Cooktime of %2$d Sec - %3$d Min. Other cooking methods may have different ranges. There is a limit of 24 hours to use your Oven. 1. Remove the broiler pan, grid, cookware and bakeware, all cooking utensils, oven racks and aluminium foil and, on some models, the temperature probe from the oven. \n\n2. Use a damp cloth to clean inside door edge and the 1 1/2\' (38mm) area around the inside oven cavity frame, being certain not to move or bend the gasket. \n\n3. Wipe out any loose soil to reduce smoke and avoid damage. At high temperatures, foods react with porcelain. staining, itching, pitting or faint white spots can result. This will not affect cooking performance. \n\n4. Cleaning duration : %s \n\nAfter having closed the door,press Start Button to begin the cycle.
Hydro Clean Instructions Hydro Self Clean Cleaning Completed Wipe down any residue and place racks back in the oven.
Self Clean Complete! Before Starting, you must open the oven door and verify the oven is empty. Before delaying, you must open the oven door and verify the oven is empty Prepare your Oven
1. Remove the broiler pan, grid, cookware and bakeware, all cooking utensils, oven racks and aluminium foil and, on some models, the temperature probe from the oven.\n
2. Use a damp cloth to clean inside door edge and the 1 1/2\' (38mm) area around the inside oven cavity frame, being certain not to move or bend the gasket.\n 3. Wipe out any loose soil to reduce smoke and avoid damage. At high temperatures, foods react with porcelain. staining, itching, pitting or faint white spots can result. This will not affect cooking performance.\n 4. Cleaning duration : %s \n After having closed the door,press Start Button to begin the cycle.\n\n\n\n Locking Oven Door Pyro Clean Instructions Locking the door for Self Clean.\nPlease do not try to open the \ndoor.

Connect to Network SAID Code Forget Network Ok, Return Back Bluetooth Connection Download the mobile app and follow the instructions SAID: Bluetooth Pairing Description describing how the PIN works for mobile phone and appliance PIN: Device Name: PAIR Bluetooth Provisioning Connection Details Signal Strength: WIFI5G: IP: SubnetMask: Router IP: DNS: RSSI: Network Info Scan the QR code to download the Whirlpool app on your phone.\nMake sure bluetooth on your phone is on.\nMake sure your phone is connected to your WiFi network.\nIf you already have the app, press next to continue. If this PIN matches the one shown on your device, press ‘Pair’ to continue. Otherwise, press back to try again. Successfully Connected Remote Enable Turned On Remote Enable has been turned on, it allows you to control your appliance from your mobile devices. Connecting to WiFi Connecting to Whirlpool Registering Oven %s is connecting to Whirlpool Server. This will typically take up to 2 mins. This is a bit longer than expected. Preheat Completed Please insert food and press OK Without preheat phase, the oven will take more time to reach the set temperature. It is recommended skipping to preheat, especially for those food categories. Check your electricity supplier information. This parameter helps the appliance in performing at best. Temperature calibration If oven seems too hot or too cool, you can calibrate it by increasing or decreasing oven’s temperature. The oven’s internal thermometer will be adjusted by this amount on all cycles. Boiling Point Calibration %s°. 000°

Preheat needed Preheat phase is needed for convection bake, skipping preheat will affect the quality of the food. Preheat won’t be available once a cooking is delayed.\n Cooking instruction Hot air will circulate in convection bake, so if you have a regular recipe, trying tune down 10-20 degree on the temperature.\n Headline The cavity needs to be preheated before inserting the food.
